qas.question: What did the new government nationalize along with land?
What international body did the new government join?
In what year did the new government enter the Arab League?
What organization would the Organization of African Unity later become?
What rate did the new government's programs significantly increase?

context: The revolutionary army established large-scale public works programs and successfully implemented an urban and rural literacy campaign, which helped dramatically increase the <a4_0>literacy<a4_0/> rate. In addition to a nationalization program of <a0_0>industry<a0_0/> and land, the new regime's foreign policy placed an emphasis on Somalia's traditional and religious links with the Arab world, eventually joining <a1_0>the Arab League<a1_0/> (AL) in <a2_0>1974<a2_0/>. That same year, Barre also served as chairman of the Organization of African Unity (OAU), the predecessor of <a3_0>the African Union<a3_0/> (AU).
